Description: Part of a triangular piece of ivory inlay: bearing the incised serekh of Djet. The upper left corner is missing and the surviving part consists of three joined fragments. The ivory has been darkened by burning.
Curator's comments: The inscription has been clarified for exhibition purposes with a white filler. For a similar object, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, pls.X. 8; XIII, 4 = A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens II (Berlin, 1929-31), no.355 and pl.37. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, 21, pl.XI, 2, pl.XIII, 1.
